resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.description: In an automated test that registers and runs a BFEBS image the initial volume is unable to be created due to the following exception. fields.summary: When creating a volume using equallogic in HA topology:  Failed to marshall response

comments.body:
Test can be found here:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester/blob/testing/testcases/cloud_user/instances/bfebstest.py

run using:

bfebstest.py --credpath <path_to_eucarc> --tests StopStart

Tried to reproduce the bug in non-HA mode using different topologies (CLC and Walrus on one machine and SC and CC on another machine, all components except NC on one machine) and did not see the issue. Verified that the issue is specific to HA setup.

Brought up a similar configuration built from source. Topology looks like this:

|192.168.51.12|CENTOS 6.4|64|BZR|[UI CLC WS CC00 SC00]|
|192.168.51.15|CENTOS 6.4|64|BZR|[UI CLC WS CC00 SC00]|
|192.168.51.17|CENTOS 6.4|64|BZR|[NC00]|

I was able to create a volume but the volume transitioned from "available" state to "creating". 

{noformat}
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-create-volume -z PARTI00 -s 1
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	1	PARTI00	creating	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	creating	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	available	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	available	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	available	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	available	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	available	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
[root@eucahost-51-12 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-E17443C8
VOLUME	vol-E17443C8	 1		PARTI00	creating	2013-04-12T03:34:51.879Z
{noformat}

I could not reproduce the actual bug.

Reran the same test with Equallogic from packages built off of internal->31eac27e5e402276d8b1cf0788c4798e2c55f4f1, eucalyptus-> 32e635ac8aeab7ac628bb43ae89d4c305165ad7e.

This time the exception wasn't present but the volume went straight to failed. Logs attached.

Note that EUCA-5624 was fixed since the time this bug was opened. May be related, may not but another datapoint. Im going to rekick the same test with the Netapp backend to see the result.

From the CLC:
{code}
2013-04-11 21:38:34 DEBUG 000003517 Volumes                  | Creating volume
2013-04-11 21:38:34 DEBUG 000003517 Volumes                  | Volume created
2013-04-11 21:38:34 DEBUG 000003517 ReportingAccountCrud     | createOrUpdateAccount id:839639441990 name:eucalyptus
2013-04-11 21:38:35 DEBUG 000000486 Faults                   | Fault notifications: waking up to service error queue.
2013-04-11 21:38:41 DEBUG 000000356 Volumes                  | Volume states: vol-BAE83BB3 failed invalid
2013-04-11 21:38:41 DEBUG 000000356 Volumes                  | VolumeStateUpdate: PARTI00 vol-BAE83BB3 GENERATING 2013-04-11 21:38:34.527 storage-volume failed=>FAIL 2GB null 2013-04-12T04:38:34.000Z invalid end-state FAIL
{code}

From the CC:
{code}
2013-04-11 21:38:34 ERROR 000001685 BlockStorage             | com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Not enabled. Will not run command. 
com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Not enabled. Will not run command. 
	at com.eucalyptus.storage.equallogic.EquallogicProvider.createEqlVolume(EquallogicProvider.java:365)
	at com.eucalyptus.storage.equallogic.EquallogicProvider.createVolume(EquallogicProvider.java:336)
	at com.eucalyptus.storage.SANManager.createVolume(SANManager.java:307)
	at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.BlockStorage$VolumeCreator.run(BlockStorage.java:1382)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)
2013-04-11 21:38:41 ERROR 000001690 EquallogicProvider       | com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Get unique failed for SANVolumeInfo using example: [SANVolumeInfo volumeId=vol-BAE83BB3 scName=PARTI00 iqn=null storeUser=null encryptedPassword=null size=null status=null snapshotOf=null id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
2013-04-11 21:38:41  WARN 000001690 BlockStorage             | Failed volume, removing it: vol-BAE83BB3
2013-04-11 21:38:41  INFO 000001690 BlockStorageChecker      | Cleaning failed volume vol-BAE83BB3
2013-04-11 21:38:41 DEBUG 000001690 SANManager               | No volume entity found in storage san volumes table: vol-BAE83BB3
{code}



Test output:
{code}
[2013-04-12 04:38:45,419] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Volume #0 (vol-BAE83BB3) State(failed), seconds elapsed: 10/240
[2013-04-12 04:38:45,420] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: vol-BAE83BB3 - Failed current status:failed
[2013-04-12 04:38:45,420] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Failure caught in monitor volumes, attempting to delete all volumes...
[2013-04-12 04:38:45,661] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Sent delete for volume: vol-BAE83BB3

I've run into the above issue too. CHAP credential lookup on Equallogic seems to be broken when two or more SCs use the same CHAP username. I'm working on a fix. 

[~viglesias] In the interest of figuring out the HA issues, can you try modifying the CHAP user and retry volume creation. CHAP user can be changed using
 
euca-modify-property -p PARTI00.storage.chapuser=a24nfv92fl56wdj

Attached cloud1.tar.gz and cloud2.tar.gz

Stopped {{eucalyptus-cloud}} on secondary SC, waited for primary SC to be enabled, created volume again and success!

May be the problem is with remote SC? :|

Shaon, the error for failing to marshall would only occur in the remote SC case because that is the only case where a message must be marshalled/unmarshalled. However, the root cause is not just the marshalling. Something is causing it to return a bad response.

[~neil] or [~zhill], could we determine if
  1. We need a fix for this for 3.3?   I'm assuming no
  2. What the effect is for the failed to marshall response... i.e. if its simply a matter of retrying.
  3. [~viglesias], [~mclark], are we seeing this in HA testing with remote SC (where it seems to manifest more reading the history)
I am marking this as fixed by Chris's recent fix for SC state transitions. If we start to see it again we can re-open.

Fixed by Chris's last commits for SC state management and bootstrap fixes.

If we see this again we can re-open, but I haven't seen it in any recent test runs with EQ or any other SAN.
